Are you ready for an adventure?
Do you want to feel for a while like a modern castaway, stranded on a desert island?
Yes
Then visit Chrissi Island.
Chrissi Island, also known as Chryssi or Gaidouronnisi, is a secluded, isolated, almost tropical island on the most southern end of Crete.
Chrissi is a piece of paradise on Earth. It is the southernmost natural park of Europe, and a gem of the Mediterranean.
Chrissi Island.
The island of Chrissi is situated approximately 9 nautical miles south of Lerapetra
Due to its incredible natural beauty and important ecosystem, it is under the protection of the European initiative NATURA 2000, as a wildlife refuge and an "area of intense natural beauty".
The island is only an hour cruise away from the port of Lerapetra.
It has an area of 4,743 square kilometers, and a maximum altitude of 27 meters.
It\'s an islet known for its exotic waters in all the shades of blue and green.
The golden beaches, made of fossilized shell beach is where the island got it name from.
The island has a Cedar forrest which extends to the center of Chrissi, covering an area of 350,000 square meters, which is one-fourth of the island.
The island Cedar forrest are protected and are over 200-300 years old.
The island as a spectacular collection of mainly grey-green, reddish-brown and black rocks.
The base rocks of Chrissi were created through the solidification of lava that poured out of an undersea volcano millions of years ago.
The 49 species of fossils (corals, shells, barnacles, urchins) found on the island comes from the sea.
The northern shores of the island are Belegrina, Hatzivolakas, and Kataprosopo, and are filled with shells.
The scenic chapel of Agios Nikolaos and the island\'s lighthouse are located West of Hatzivolakas.
On the northeast of the church, there is an old salt marsh and the island\'s only house, bulit atop of ancient remnants.
There a wells and carved tombs on the south and southwest of Agios Nikolaos, with the biggest tomb dating back to the Roman era.
Kataprosopo faces the Mikronisi islet, on the east of Chrissi, and is a habitat for thousands of birds.
To visit Chrissi you can take one of the boats that make the route from Lerapetra
Chrissi Daily Cruises, organises daily cruises from the port of Ierapetra to the island of Chrissi".
Chrissi Daily Cruises depart daily from May to October, departing from 10.00am until 13.00pm.
The Municipality of Ierapetra collects 1 euro from every ticket, as an administrative fee for passengers over 4 years old visiting the island of Chrissi.
There is a free parking area at the port of Lerapetra.
The trip from the port of Lerapetra to the exotic Chrissi lasts about an hour, sometimes accompanied by seagulls and dolphins.
The self-service bar of the ship shall remain open throughout the cruise, offering light meals, with salads, wine, soft drinks, coffee, ice creams, etc.
Tickets can be purchase from varying tour agency across Crete and local touring office in Lerapetra.
The ticket price includes 24% VAT, all legal fees, and a written guided tour in your language.
There\'s a eatery place on the island where you can get hot food and drinks
Umbrellas and sunbeds are also available on the island for a fee
The Municipality collection of 1 euro contribute towards protecting the island
There are vendors where you can buy items made from fossils found on the island
Portable toilets are also available on the island for free, please make use of it
Hammocks can be found in some area of the island, use accordingly
Local touring offices will have details for transfers if you are from areas outside Lerapetra
Bin\'s are provided on the island, empty all rubbish there and not on the island
Smoking around bushes and woodlands are prohibited or starting a fire
Hiking outside the designated paths and beaches are prohibited
Collection of rocks, fossils, shells and ancient finds are prohibited
Collection of plants or any animal catching are prohibited
Free camping on the island in the evening and overnight are also prohibited
Any kind of pollution are prohibited, bins and toilets are provided
Make sure you are back at your boat 10 at least 10 minutes before departure
Make sure you don\'t swim out too far in the waters into the ocean
